robot

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot.Navigator

  • public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Navigator class provides all the methods to allow the robot to move and navigate through the map. This version of the class was written for the purposes of a unit test to determine whether the robot can find a path from point A to point B given new obstacle information along the way, travelling only along lines parallel to the X and Y axes, (for the purposes of having more accurate odometry correction). Therefore, it does not actually use ultrasonic data (that will be a different test) to detect blocks, but will be given new block information at various intervals, from an outside class.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Solvie Lee

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        The conventional method of travelling to a point; calculates and turns to the heading it must face and drives the distance that it must go to arrive at the destination described by input points. May be deprecated.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of destination
        y - Y coordinate of destination

      • travelToWithAvoidance

        public boolean travelToWithAvoidance(double x,
                                     double y)
        Travels to the destination point in a similar manner as the travelTo method. However, it will slow down when it sees an obstacle, and stop when it is a certain distance away from it. (TODO: define that distance, maybe pass it in as a parameter)
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of destination
        y - Y coordinate of destination
        Returns:
        A boolean value that is false if the robot detected an obstacle and true if it was able to reach the destination point without detecting any obstacles.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        This method turns the robot in place to face the specified destination heading.
        Parameters:
        theta - the destination heading value in degrees, with the positive x axis representing 0 and the positive y axis representing 90. If theta is a negative value, the robot will turn towards it counterclockwise, and if theta is positive, the robot will turn towards it clockwise.

      • getArcTan

        public double getArcTan(double x,
                        double y,
                        double currX,
                        double currY)
        Calculates the destination heading based on the current point coordinates and the destination point coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinates of destination
        y - Y coordinates of destination
        currX - current X coordinates (starting point)
        currY - current Y coordinates
        Returns:
        a heading angle in degrees.

      • turnClockwise

        public void turnClockwise()
        Allows the robot to turn Clockwise.

        Allows the robot to turn counter clockwise.

      • setDetectionInfo

        public void setDetectionInfo(boolean[] info,
                             boolean[] update)
        Allows outside classes to set the boolean values of whether there is an object in front of the robot, whether the object is within D cm and whether the object's color was seen.
        Parameters:
        info - the boolean values
        update - boolean values of whether we want to update this value.

      • getOdo

        public Odometer getOdo()

        Returns:
        the navigator's odometer.
